sentence: Shares of The Home Depot Inc.HD rose 2.2% in the pre-market trading session after the company reported better-than-expected results for fourth-quarter and fiscal 20Array5.
Results benefited from the company's focus on improving customer experience, solid execution and persistent housing market recovery.

The company posted fiscal fourth-quarter adjusted earnings of $Array.Array7 per share, which increased ArrayArray.4% from the year-ago quarter figure and beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $Array.Array0.
Net sales advanced 9.5% to $20,980 million from $Array9,Array62 million in the year-ago quarter and were also ahead of the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $20,350 million.
The company's overall comparable-store sales (comps) increased 7.Array%, while comps in the U.S. grew 8.9%.
Gross profit in the reported quarter improved 8.7% to $7,Array56 million from $6,582 million in the year-ago quarter, primarily driven by higher sales.
However, gross profit margin contracted 20 basis points (bps) to 34.Array%.
Improved gross profit led operating income to soar Array6.3% to $2,549 million during the quarter.
Further, operating margin expanded 70 bps from the year-ago quarter to Array2.Array%.
Home Depot's adjusted earnings for fiscal 20Array5 came in at $5.52 per share, up Array7.2% year over year, coming in much ahead of the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $5.34.
Including one-time items, earnings for the fiscal ascended Array5.9% to $5.46 per share.
Further, net sales for the fiscal escalated 6.4% year over year to $88,5Array9 million.
Net sales also cruised ahead of the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $87,9Array6 million.

Home Depot ended the fiscal year with cash and cash equivalents of $2,2Array6 million, long-term debt (excluding current maturities) of $Array7,9Array3 million, and shareholders' equity of $6,3Array6 million.
Also, in fiscal 20Array5, the company generated $9,373 million of net cash from operations.
Concurrent with the earnings release, the company raised its quarterly cash dividend to 69 cents per share, marking an increase of Array7% from the prior payout.
The dividend is payable on Mar 24, to shareholders on record as of Mar Array0, 20Array6.
Following the robust end to fiscal 20Array5 and taking into account the impact of currency headwinds, the company provided its sales, comps and earnings guidance for fiscal 20Array6.
The company projects sales growth of 5.Array%-6%, while comps are anticipated to increase 3.7%-4.5% in the fiscal.
Further, the company expects gross margin to remain flat, while operating margin is anticipated to expand 70 bps in fiscal 20Array6.
The company estimates depreciation and amortization expense of nearly $Array9 million.
Tax rate is projected to be 37%.
Home Depot now envisions diluted earnings per share to grow Array2%-Array3%, with earnings coming in the range of $6.Array2-$6.Array8 per share.
In fiscal 20Array6, the company plans to buy back nearly $5 billion worth of shares.
The company projects operating cash flows of about $Array0 billion and capital expenditure of nearly $Array.64 billion.
Also, the company plans to open five new stores in Mexico in the fiscal.

Additionally, the company reiterated its capital allocation plan, targeting dividend payout ratio of nearly 50% of earnings; continue to repurchase shares using excess cash flows, with plans to complete the remaining $ArrayArray billion share repurchase authorization by fiscal 20Array7 end; and maintaining high return on invested capital, aiming to reach 35% by fiscal 20Array8 end.
Currently, Home Depot carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).
Better-ranked stocks in the same industry are Builders FirstSource, Inc. BLDR , with a Zacks Rank #Array (Strong Buy) and Beacon Roofing Supply, Inc. BECN , with a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
Another stock performing well in the broader retail sector is Zumiez Inc. ZUMZ , carrying a Zacks Rank #2.
